DOC.brief_summary: Objective : Objective pilot feasibility study monitor crSO2 use NIRS INVOS 5100 ( Somanetics , USA ) addition SpO2 monitoring guide supplemental oxygen delivery respiratory support base measurement preterm neonate first 15 minute birth . Patients : Preterm neonates < 34+0 week gestation bear via caesarean section and/or require respiratory support eligible study . Design : A prospective two-centre randomize control pilot feasibility study Methods : Study group : Pulse oximetry use measure SpO2 heart rate routine non-invasive monitoring first minute resuscitation . In addition first 15 minute NIRS measurement record . crSO2 measurement addition SpO2 measurement use guide supplemental oxygen support respiratory support first 15 minute birth . Control group : Only SpO2 measurement use guide supplemental oxygen support respiratory support first 15 minute birth . Hypothesis : Supplemental oxygen support respiratory support guide crSO2 SpO2 measurement reduce time % minute crSO2 < 10th > 90th centile preterm neonate first 15 minute birth Outcome Parameter : Primary outcome parameter duration % minute crSO2 < 10th > 90th centile .
DOC.criteria: Preterm neonate < 34+0 week caesarean section Decision conduct full life support Written inform consent No decision conduct full life support No write informed consent Congenital malformation
